intro: Phacelia insularis var. continentis, commonly known as the continental phacelia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of North America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It has small, ovate leaves with a rough texture and is often found in semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
